meanings.definition: A person who wastes or spends extravagantly.
meanings.sent1: The squanderer bought expensive clothes he didn't need.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a squanderer for always buying things on impulse.
meanings.sent3: The squanderer's wallet was always empty from buying unnecessary items.
meanings.sent4: Like a squanderer of time, he wasted his days on meaningless tasks.
meanings.sent5: The squanderer's lavish lifestyle led to financial ruin.

meanings.sent1: Don't squander your money on things you don't really need.
meanings.sent2: She tends to squander her time on social media instead of studying.
meanings.sent3: He would squander his energy on trivial arguments.
meanings.sent4: The company cannot afford to squander its resources on unnecessary projects.
meanings.sent5: If you squander your opportunities, you may regret it later.
